Gingerbread Overnight Oats

Jump to Recipe

Start your mornings off right with a delicious twist on a classic breakfast staple – Gingerbread Overnight Oats! This easy and nutritious recipe combines the heartiness of rolled oats with the warm, comforting spices of gingerbread, making it perfect for the colder months. Not only are these overnight oats packed with flavor, but they also provide a great source of fiber and protein to keep you energized throughout the day. With just a few simple ingredients like milk, yogurt, maple syrup, and a blend of aromatic spices, you can prepare a wholesome breakfast in advance that’s ready to enjoy when you wake up. Whether you prefer to savor them cold straight from the fridge or warmed up for a cozy feel, these Gingerbread Overnight Oats are sure to become a favorite in your breakfast rotation. Make them for yourself or share with family – either way, you’ll love the delightful taste of the holiday season in every spoonful!

Ingredients

rolled oats

Use old-fashioned rolled oats for the best texture; they absorb liquid well and create a creamy consistency. If you don't have rolled oats, quick oats can be used, but they may become mushy. For a gluten-free option, ensure you use certified gluten-free oats.

milk (dairy or non-dairy)

You can use any type of milk, such as whole, skim, almond, soy, or oat milk. For a creamier texture, opt for whole milk or coconut milk. If you're looking for a lower-calorie option, almond or skim milk are great substitutes.

yogurt (plain or vanilla)

Plain yogurt adds a tangy flavor and creaminess, while vanilla yogurt adds sweetness. For a dairy-free version, use coconut yogurt or almond yogurt. Greek yogurt can be used for a thicker texture, or mix regular yogurt with a little extra milk to achieve desired consistency.

maple syrup

Maple syrup adds a rich sweetness; if you don't have it, honey or agave syrup can be good substitutes. For a sugar-free option, consider using stevia or monk fruit sweetener, adjusting the amount to taste.

ground ginger

Ground ginger provides a warm, spicy flavor. Fresh ginger can be used instead; use about a tablespoon of grated fresh ginger for a more intense flavor. If you want a milder spice, reduce the amount slightly.

ground cinnamon

Cinnamon enhances the warm flavors in the dish. You can use Ceylon cinnamon for a sweeter, more delicate flavor, or Saigon cinnamon for a bolder taste. If you're out of cinnamon, you can use pumpkin spice mix as a substitute.

nutmeg

Nutmeg adds depth and warmth; be careful not to overuse it, as it can be overpowering. Freshly grated nutmeg can provide a more aromatic flavor compared to pre-ground. If you don’t have nutmeg, you can increase the cinnamon slightly for a similar warmth.

vanilla extract

Vanilla extract enhances sweetness and flavor complexity. If you don't have vanilla extract, you can substitute with vanilla bean paste or scrapings from a vanilla pod. For a non-alcoholic version, use vanilla flavoring.

chopped nuts (optional)

Chopped nuts like walnuts, pecans, or almonds can add crunch and healthy fats. Toast them lightly before adding for enhanced flavor. If you're nut-free, consider using seeds like pumpkin or sunflower seeds instead.

sultanas or raisins (optional)

Sultanas add sweetness and chewiness; raisins can be used interchangeably. If you want a different flavor, try dried cranberries or chopped dried apricots for a tart twist.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Combine Ingredients

    In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of rolled oats, 1 cup of milk (dairy or non-dairy), 1/2 cup of yogurt (plain or vanilla), and 2 tablespoons of maple syrup. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.

  • Step 2: Add Spices and Flavorings

    Next, add 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg, and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Stir thoroughly until all the spices are well incorporated, giving your oats that delicious gingerbread flavor.

  • Step 3: Incorporate Optional Ingredients

    If you like, fold in some chopped nuts and sultanas or raisins to the mixture. This will add extra texture and flavor to your overnight oats, making them even more delightful.

  • Step 4: Divide and Store

    Divide the mixture into two jars or containers. Make sure they are airtight to keep the oats fresh. Cover the jars and refrigerate them overnight or for at least 4 hours. This allows the oats to absorb the liquid and flavors.

  • Step 5: Serve and Enjoy

    In the morning, give the oats a good stir. If the mixture is too thick, add a splash of milk to reach your desired consistency. You can enjoy your gingerbread overnight oats cold or warm them up in the microwave for a cozy breakfast.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I measure 1 cup of rolled oats accurately?

Use a dry measuring cup. Scoop the oats into the cup, then level it off with a straight edge like a knife for an accurate measurement.

What type of milk can I use for overnight oats?

You can use any milk you prefer, including dairy milk, almond milk, soy milk, or oat milk. Each will give a slightly different flavor and texture.

Can I substitute the yogurt?

Yes! You can use Greek yogurt, flavored yogurt, or even a dairy-free yogurt alternative if you prefer.

How long do I need to let the oats soak?

Overnight is best, but you can let them soak for at least 4 hours. This allows the oats to absorb the liquid and soften.

Is it safe to eat overnight oats that have been in the fridge for more than a day?

Generally, overnight oats can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Make sure they are properly sealed and check for any off smells before consuming.

What can I add to make my overnight oats more nutritious?

Consider adding chia seeds, flax seeds, or fresh fruits like bananas, berries, or apples for added fiber and vitamins.

How do I know if my spices (ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg) are still good?

Spices should have a strong aroma. If they smell weak or stale, they may have lost their potency and it's best to replace them.

Can I warm up overnight oats?

Absolutely! If you prefer them warm, simply heat them in the microwave for 30-60 seconds, adding a splash of milk if needed.

What should I do if my oats are too thick in the morning?

Just stir in a little extra milk until you reach your desired consistency.

How can I make my overnight oats more flavorful?

Experiment with different flavorings like cocoa powder, peanut butter, or additional fruits. The more you play with it, the more you'll discover what you love!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This recipe can easily be made vegan by using non-dairy milk and a plant-based yogurt alternative. For gluten-free options, ensure you use certified gluten-free rolled oats. To reduce sugar, consider using unsweetened yogurt and reducing the amount of maple syrup. For nut allergies, simply omit the chopped nuts and replace with seeds such as pumpkin or sunflower seeds for added crunch.

Pairings

For a delightful breakfast experience, pair Gingerbread Overnight Oats with sliced bananas or fresh berries for a burst of fresh flavor. A dollop of whipped cream or a sprinkle of granola can add a crunchy texture. For a drink, consider a spiced chai latte or a warm cup of apple cider to complement the warm spices in the oats. If you're feeling indulgent, a splash of Irish cream or a scoop of ice cream can transform it into a dessert.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Gingerbread Overnight Oats in clear glass jars to showcase the beautiful layers. Top with additional chopped nuts, a drizzle of maple syrup, and a sprinkle of cinnamon or nutmeg before serving. For a cozy breakfast, warm the oats in the microwave for a minute or two, and serve in a bowl with your choice of toppings. You can also serve it alongside a warm muffin or slice of gingerbread for a festive touch.

#

Gingerbread Overnight Oats

10 min
$3.5
350 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianNut-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Breakfast

Tags:

BreakfastHealthyEasy

Description

Creamy, spiced oats infused with the warm flavors of gingerbread, perfect for a hassle-free breakfast!

Ingredients

  • rolled oats: 1 cup
  • milk (dairy or non-dairy): 1 cup
  • yogurt (plain or vanilla): 1/2 cup
  • maple syrup: 2 tablespoons
  • ground ginger: 1 teaspoon
  • ground cinnamon: 1 teaspoon
  • nutmeg: 1/4 teaspoon
  • vanilla extract: 1/2 teaspoon
  • chopped nuts (optional): to taste
  • sultanas or raisins (optional): to taste
